body:
Comment 3 by **disposaboy@dby.me**: 
Chromium, it reports version: 13.0.782.107 (Developer Build 94237 Linux) Ubuntu 11.04
I don't think it would've been a problem in "Chromium" but in the engine Webkit, either
way I can't reproduce it now so I can only guess it's been fixed.

Maybe it's best to just document what will happen and maybe have a way to turn it off.
The first time I saw the error it was pretty confusing, it actually distracted from the
real error message. At the time I had other things to do so I just moved on. Second time
I just assumed it was some nonsense "Chromium" was outputting. It wasn't until about a
week ago when I was casually reading through the http code that I came upon it - by
accident - I was amazed.

I wasn't sure if that was a bug or not until last night I tried communicating with the
server via ajax and found it doesn't work properly because of the added text(of-course I
could just use json but then I'd encounter it again somewhere else).
